title: Pear and ginger purée

ingredients.content: 500 g pears (approx. 4 pears), peeled, cored and cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
20 g water, plus extra if needed
½ - 1 cm piece fresh ginger, peeled and cut into thin slices
natural yoghurt, to serve (optional - see Tips)

preparations.content: Place pears and water into mixing bowl and cook <b>20 min/100°C/speed 1<b> or until very tender.
Add cinnamon and ginger and blend <b>15 sec/speed 8<b>, to desired consistency.

Set aside 1 serving, then freeze the remainder in individual portions for future use. If needed, stir through a little more water or your baby's milk to get the consistency just right before serving. Serve with natural yoghurt (optional).

hintsAndTricks: Adding spice, such as cinnamon and fresh ginger, to your baby's purées is a source of goodness and it also helps your baby become accustomed to new flavours. Exposure to a variety of tastes is particularly crucial in the first year of life when babies are typically more accepting of unfamiliar tastes.
You can replace the natural yoghurt with kefir milk in this recipe.

Fruit purées like this one also make a lovely addition to your baby's porridge or rice cereal if you're serving one. Just be sure to give your baby plenty of iron-rich, savoury purées too. Fruit is nutritious and it's important that your baby develops a liking for various fruit flavours, but offering less sweet options is crucial too.
